entries.meaning: A rigid bracelet or anklet, especially one with no clasp.

description: Unknown, yet probably from bang +‎ -le (frequentative suffix).

verbs.description: bangle (third-person singular simple present bangles, present participle bangling, simple past and past participle bangled)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) to beat about or beat down, as corn by the wind.
(obsolete or dialectal) to waste away little by little; squander carelessly; fritter (away).
examples: Thus betwixt hope and fear, suspicions, angers […] betwixt falling in, falling out, etc., we bangle away our best days, befool out our times […].

entries.meaning: (intransitive) (falconry) to beat about in the air; flutter: said of a hawk which does not rise steadily and then swoop down upon its prey.
(intransitive) to flap or hang down loosely, as a hat brim or an animal's ear.

description: Apparently from bang (verb) +‎ -le (instrumental suffix), perhaps ultimately connected with Proto-Germanic *bangilaz. Compare Dutch bengel, German Bengel.

entries.meaning: (dialectal) The cut branch of a tree; a large, rough stick; the largest piece of wood in a bundle of twigs
